description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Kusadasi" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Kusadasi

sources.snippet: Kusadasi coast (Ku≈üadasƒ± Sahil) for many people this is one of the best walking areas. Kusadasi coast is quite long. During the coastal walks, you will see very beautiful landscapes around, and you can take beautiful pictures.
sources.shortName: Kusadasi Beaches: 7 Beaches and 4 Best Bays in Nature

reviews.text:
Absolutely fell in love with Kusadasi with an excellent hotel experience from start to finish
The people were so friendly and helpful and the shopping was varied and the leather outlet ‚ÄúGolf Leather and Fur‚Äù was fantastic with the level of superior quality and choice - well worth a visit
What a beautiful place yes it can get busy but it felt like the streets can handle it. Plenty of shops and restaurants and plenty of places to just stop and chill. Really enjoyed it.

Kusadasi is beautiful.  It feels very touristy.  It's busy.  It tries to pander to every walk of life.  BUT,  that's a good thing! ü•∞

I wasn't here for it but a few friends of mine were and if you want something cosmetic done, this is probably the place to go. üòÅüçë

The people are super friendly and helpful.  The food is good.  The alcohol is affordable.  And flights are cheap.  There's loads of things to do, see and eat here. üòçüíú

Also, look at that sunset. Stunning!

places.generalDescription: Ladies Beach, also known as Kadinlar Denizi, is a well-known and lively beach in Kusadasi. Initially reserved for women during the Ottoman period, it now welcomes everyone. The beach offers a vibrant atmosphere with its palm-lined promenade featuring shops, bars, cafes, and hotels that create a resort-like feel.

sources.snippet: Ladies Beach, known as Kadinlar Denizi in Turkish, stands out as one of Kusadasi's most popular and bustling beaches. Initially designated exclusively for female bathers, the beach is now open to all, offering a vibrant atmosphere with its palm-lined promenade adorned with shops, bars, cafes, and hotels, creating a resort-like ambiance. Renowned for its prime location near Kusadasi's center, the beach boasts clean, shallow waters, a kilometer-long stretch of sandy shoreline, and various amenities including water sports, changing rooms, umbrellas, sunbeds, and restrooms.

The Turkish name Kadƒ±nlar Denizi, which is a translation of Women's Sea, comes from the historical usage of the beach during the Ottoman period. At that time, only women were allowed to swim there; however, today both men and women are allowed in the beach. The Beach is lined with palm trees, full of shops, bars, cafes, restaurants, and many hotels to the extent that the beach looks like a resort in itself.

The historic Ladies Beach Kusadasi is one of the most famous and popular beaches in the town. The beach initially had a women-only policy during the last years of the Ottoman Empire. Nevertheless, after the foundation of the republic, the beach opened to all genders, and now that Ladies Beach is open to all (and it has been for the last decade), it has become one of the best beaches in the area.
sources.shortName: Ku≈üadasƒ±¬†Beaches Travel Guide: 12 Best Beaches In Kusadasi

sources.snippet: The most popular beach on the Kusadasi coastline is Ladies Beach which owes its name to the fact that the women of Kusadasi were once able to bathe here unashamed (without men being present). Nowadays, men are also welcome!. This beach is in a built-up area with many small hotels, hostels and summer houses.

Ladies Beach, one of the most famous beaches in Kusadasi, has the blue flag title. Its name remained as ladies' beach because it was used only by women during the Ottoman period. Today, it is a deep blue, clean beach that is open to the public and can be enjoyed by everyone, regardless of gender.

Ladies Beach (Kadƒ±nlar Denizi Plajƒ±) The name of this place is only Ladies Beach, anyone can enter. It is one of the closest beaches to the town center of Kusadasi district. This beach, which both local and foreign holidaymakers flock to, especially on weekends, is quite famous and clean.
sources.shortName: Kusadasi Beaches: 7 Beaches and 4 Best Bays in Nature

sources.snippet: If you're feeling adventurous, head to Ladies Beach, where you can try your hand at water sports like jet skiing and parasailing. And when hunger strikes, don't forget to indulge in some freshly caught seafood at one of the beachside restaurants. Trust me, your taste buds will thank you!

Ladies‚Äô Beach is easily accessible from the town center of Ku≈üadasƒ±, with various transportation options available. The beach is well-connected by local buses, taxis, and even rental cars. Its proximity to Izmir makes it a convenient spot for both domestic and international travelers.
sources.siteName: Tourism Turkey: Top Travel Spots and Tourist Attractions
sources.shortName: Ladies' Beach, Ku≈üadasƒ± - Turkey: Best Beaches to Visit 2025

sources.snippet: Ladies Beach, or Kadinlar Denizi, is renowned for its safety measures and historical significance. Ku≈üadasƒ± Long Beach, or Uzun Plaj, is a scenic beach offering various amenities and natural beauty. Love Beach, or Sevgi Plajƒ±, is a family-friendly beach surrounded by eucalyptus trees.

It‚Äôs named as such because back in the Ottoman period, only women were allowed to access the beach. The beach has a one kilometer stretch of sandy beach and clean, shallow waters. You can find plenty of sun beds and umbrellas for rent to enjoy this beach.
sources.shortName: Kusadasi‚Äôs 9 Best Long & Ladies Beach Hotels

sources.snippet: Ladies Beach is one of the most popular beaches in Ku≈üadasƒ±. It got its name because it was once only open to women. Today, everyone can visit this beach, and it attracts both local and foreign tourists, especially in the summer.

sources.shortName: Beaches In Kusadasi: A Guide For Cruisers
10 Top-Rated Attractions & Things to Do in Ku≈üadasƒ±
24 Kusadasi's Best Beaches, Beach Clubs, Boat Tours (Map included)

places.name: Ladies Beach

reviews.text:
Taking a walk along Kadƒ±nlar Plajƒ± in Ku≈üadasƒ± is one of those simple pleasures that stays with you long after the day ends. The promenade stretches along the Aegean coast with an easy, calming rhythm-waves gently brushing the shore, seagulls overhead, and a warm breeze carrying the scent of the sea.

The beach is clean and well-kept, and the walking path is lined with cafes, restaurants, and small shops. Whether you're after a peaceful morning stroll or a sunset walk with golden light reflecting on the water, Kadƒ±nlar Plajƒ± offers a beautiful setting. The vibe is friendly and relaxed-locals and tourists alike enjoying the same stretch of coast, often stopping to take photos or grab an ice cream.

It's not just a beach-it's a social spot, a scenic route, and a peaceful escape all in one. I especially recommend going in the early evening when the sun begins to set behind the hills; the light, the colors, and the atmosphere are truly unforgettable.
Awesome beach with lots of cool restaurants, places to rent cabana and chairs, and even a 40 foot platform dive. One of our Highlights was hanging out here.

I was pleasantly surprised by Ladies Beach - the water was so clear and clean. It got very busy throughout the afternoon but when we arrived at 10.30 there were plenty of sun beds available - all 300tl each and parasols are free. I was happy to see lots of people dispose of their rubbish although there are a lot of cigarette butts all over the sand.

places.generalDescription: G√ºvercinada Kalesi, located at the mouth of Kusadasi Bay, was strategically built to protect the harbor. The inner castle was constructed by Barbaros Hayrettin Pasha and surrounded by walls built by Ilyas Aga during the Peloponnese Rebellion. The approximately 3-meter-high walls were erected to defend against attacks from the islands and sea. The stones used in its construction were brought from Yilanciburnu.

sources.snippet: Known in English as Pigeon Island, G√ºvercinada is a peninsula connected to the mainland Kusadasi through a relatively narrow, man-made causeway that is 350 m in length. Pigeon Island is a favorite spot for a seaside walk; it has a castle and swimming beaches, including a private beach and cafe with a view back across the bay to the harbor of Kusadasi. The public beaches are located at the back of the peninsula.

places.name: G√ºvercinada Kalesi (K√º√ß√ºkada)

reviews.text: Free administration for this historical place. The view is great. We spent roughly 40 minutes strolling around the castle area. There are some coffee and ice cream shops by the entrance. The WC, free, is also by the shop. Definitely recommended ‚úÖüëç‚ù§Ô∏è

G√ºvercinada is one of the historical places to visit in Ku≈üadasƒ±. The entrance was free when we went and I think it still is. There is a green area inside where you can easily walk around and there are statues of some important people and informative biographies. When you see the island from a distance, it looks very impressive. I especially recommend seeing it with night lighting.

Located in the Hacƒ±feyzullah Neighborhood of Ku≈üadasƒ± District, the G√ºvercinada Castle was built in a position protecting the port at the mouth of the Ku≈üadasƒ± Gulf. On the G√ºvercinada, there is an inner castle built by Barbaros Hayrettin Pasha and walls built by ƒ∞lyas Aƒüa. These walls were built during the Morean Revolt to prevent attacks from the islands and the sea. The walls were built approximately 3 meters high to surround the island. The stones used in the construction of the castle were brought from Yƒ±lancƒ±burnu. To the south of the walls, there is a round-arched castle entrance gate with two towers that can be reached by stairs facing east. The north tower is pentagonal, while the south tower is cylindrical. The inscription space above the gate shows that there was an inscription here before. The inscription of the construction of the walls is on the northern tower wall. The inscription is 4 lines and 20 verses. Year 1242 (1826).

places.generalDescription: Kusadasi Long Beach, also known as Uzun Plaj, is a popular destination with its pristine sandy shores and clear waters. It's a Blue Flag beach offering excellent facilities for visitors. Families enjoy the refreshing sea and kids love playing in the sand. While it can get crowded during peak season, there are still opportunities to find peaceful spots along the coast. Visitors can explore nearby cafes and restaurants or take a leisurely sunset walk along this spacious beach.
places.name: Kusadasi Long Beach

reviews.text:
Long Beach (Uzun Plaj) in Kusadasi is a must-visit for its pristine sands, crystal-clear waters, and excellent facilities. This Blue Flag beach was the perfect start to our Turkish adventure. The kids loved splashing around in the refreshing sea, even in the scorching 45-degree heat. We easily found free parking nearby.

Initially, we were scammed by a local who insisted we pay 500 TL for sun loungers and umbrellas, claiming we weren't staying at a nearby resort. Later, an official intervened, revealing the loungers were actually free and that we had been duped. We managed to recover our money, but the situation escalated into a heated argument between the official and a seemingly involved individual.

Feeling sorry for the young man who helped us set up the loungers, I gave him a 100 TL tip. It was clear he was just a small cog in a larger scam orchestrated by someone else.
Very great beach with beautiful sunsets.
I love this beach. My favourite place in kusadasi. This year I noticed how dirty it was, fag butts and rubbish everywhere.

places.generalDescription: Sandal Beach Club in Kusadasi is a popular spot for both locals and tourists, offering a perfect seafront location and vibrant nightlife with entertaining DJ nights. This private resort provides a serene and calm atmosphere, making it an ideal escape from the bustling crowds. Visitors can enjoy the beautiful beach, access to the refreshing sea, and reasonable prices for food and drinks.

sources.snippet: Sandal Beach is another of the most popular beaches in the area of Kusadasi (near Ladies Beach). Unlike most beaches on this list, Sandal Beach is a private resort, and you must pay a fee to enter. The beach is usually very calm and serene.
sources.shortName: Ku≈üadasƒ±¬†Beaches Travel Guide: 12 Best Beaches In Kusadasi

places.name: Sandal Beach

reviews.text: Amazing place, very good price üëå, I recommend ü´∂

The service was very decent, and the staff were polite. The atmosphere is lovely - great for relaxing. The cocktails were also really good. We didn't order any food, so I can't say anything about that.

There's a 500 TL entrance fee, which I think is fair, especially since it wasn't crowded - a big advantage in my opinion. The water is very clean. You enter the sea directly from the deck, there's no gradual beach entry. There are some sea plants at the bottom, but that didn't bother us personally.

All in all, a pleasant experience - I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a more peaceful beach spot in Ku≈üadasƒ±.

Update: visited again on Sat 28th September, as it was the end of season there were no entry or sun lounger fees. Food and drink prices are very reasonable with good service. We used the adjacent hotel beach to access the sea via sand. Sandal Beach is still a good place to visit.

Original review: June 2023
Nice place to get away from the crowds nearby. It has a shared beach with a hotel which has fresh cold sea water. A little understaffed so the service can be slow, but staff were polite and helpful. Food prices were average for the area - the frozen juices were very good. Sadly only one changing room and toilet was available. Sun loungers were good and situated on decking with a good sea view. The music got louder as the day went on. Overall a good experience with no issues.
I think Davutlar sahil is yhe best beach around the region. Beautiful sandy beach. Not too busy. Many shops around. Great place to watch sunset. Definitely recommend here

Found this hidden gem of a beach scrolling through google maps. Lovely sand beaches, locals and hardly any tourists. Great for the tourist who wants to feel like a local. üòäkids play area, shower, changing facilities and aqua slides.
One of the best positions on the Long beach. Beach volleyball, restaurant, showers, cabin, enough space for parking, sandy beach

places.name: Sevgi Plajƒ±

reviews.text: Wasn't crowded,  nice sand beach and walking/biking path
Ku≈üadasƒ± Davutlar Love Beach has a walking and cycling path that is more than 10 km long. There are dozens of cafes and restaurants along the path.

Harikalar.
It was really really nice sun set.

places.address: Davutlar, Cengiz Topel Cd., 09430 Ku≈üadasƒ±/Aydƒ±n, T√ºrkiye

places.name: Pygela Plajƒ±

reviews.text:
Located North of Kusadasi and south of Adaland Aquapark is this charming stretch of beach.

We did pay 100lr for each sunlounger and small table. It might be a bit pricey, but the gentleman keep his section of the beach not only spotless, but racked/smoothed out the sand around the loungers he was operating.

The sea was crystal clear had about 50-60% capacity and never felt overcrowded (unlike Ladies beach).

We felt safe and relaxed and could of stayed there all day (complete opposite of Ladies Beach).

The only issue is there isn't a taxi rank, but if you ask the local shops near the intersection they'll call you a taxi or you can try using the BiTaksi App (not used myself).

I highly recommend this beach.

Very clean sand beach, most sections have big rocks in the beach but still worth the visit. The environment is clean and full of warm welcoming services. Great for families with young kids. If asked for a family session, they'll show you a session with no rocks

My local beach hence one of my favourites. A little stoned in places but enough facilities like sun shades, sun beds and refreshment providers to make this a nice place for a relaxing day. Unfortunately the nearby Kustur beach bazzar suffered a fire.

places.address: Bayraklƒ±dede, Ku≈ütur √ñn√º Yolu Cd., 09400 Ku≈üadasƒ±/Aydƒ±n, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Yƒ±lancƒ± Burnu, located in Kusadasi, is a beautiful natural spot with stunning views and a peaceful atmosphere. It's within walking distance of Hacivat Shop Art Center and Yƒ±lancƒ± Burnu Park, offering a serene garden view from the accommodation. Visitors can enjoy leisurely walks and admire the tranquil seaside scenery. The area also features a lovely beach that tends to be quiet outside of peak tourist seasons.

sources.snippet: Yƒ±lancƒ± Burnu Beach is one of Kusadasi's natural treasures worth exploring, offering an atmosphere where history and nature come together. It's an ideal escape for visitors seeking a peaceful setting. The historical ruins around the beach offer insights into the area's past, while the stunning views provide a chance to relax.

Yilanci Cape Beach (Yƒ±lancƒ± Burnu) It is one of the closest beaches to the center of Kusadasi. The beach is generally quiet and is one of the good places to relax. There is a feature that everyone will love here, the view of Kusadasi castle from the beach is beautiful.
sources.shortName: Kusadasi Beaches: 7 Beaches and 4 Best Bays in Nature

sources.snippet: Yƒ±lancƒ± Burnu is known as the most beautiful spot in Ku≈üadasƒ±. Although it‚Äôs a public beach, there are two private beach resorts in Yƒ±lancƒ± Burnu. Also, various caf√©s, restaurants, pubs, and stores nearby allow you to bring your own food or drinks to the beach.
sources.shortName: Ku≈üadasƒ±¬†Beaches Travel Guide: 12 Best Beaches In Kusadasi

sources.snippet: This beach, located in the Yƒ±lancƒ± cape region of Kusadasi, also includes the entertainment center called Jade Beach Club. It is one of the unique areas where you can swim and listen to music accompanied by a DJ, and watch the view of G√ºvercin Island Castle.

Snake Island is so-called because the shape of the island resembles the head of a snake and lies adjacent to Pigeon Island. During high season two beach clubs arise here. These famous clubs are intended for beachgoers with a taste for luxury.
Yƒ±lancƒ± Burnu, historically known as Neapolis, is a picturesque peninsula situated in Ku≈üadasƒ±, Turkey. It is recognized as the original site of Ku≈üad...

places.name: Yƒ±lancƒ± Burnu

reviews.text: Very nice beach club.

As others have mentioned the place needs some TLC. When you view from a distance it is stunning but when you get down to the beach near the Jade Beach Club, the beach is full of cigarette nubs and rubbish. You can find nice spots to sunbathe but the Jade Beach Club is not worth going to.
The peninsula part itself has been taken over by filthy homeless tramps. They are hostile and have out signs up saying private property. It is not private property. I would have walked past them and just went where I wanted but the sun was just setting and I didn't fancy being surrounded by crazy drunk bums at dark.

The police nice to move them along and stop them destroying the natural beauty. The area needs some investment, development and cleaning

You can see this small peninsula from the Kusadasi Castle, and you might be tempted to walk over and visit. If it's 2024, I wouldn't. Apparently the city is ok with someone squatting on the land (property lines seem to be very much up for grabs and unenforced in this area). There are hand painted signs that say ‚ÄúPrivate Property. No access allowed. There are dogs.‚Äù Very childish looking. The only dog we saw walked by us very friendly. There are some tents. It's obvious that some homeless person is just trying to claim the land. Reading the other reviews, it seems like this is an old man and his three dogs trying to do something illegal - claim land that isn't his. This is within 30 minute walking distance of the cruise port, so it's quite surprising that the city authorities allow this behavior.

places.address: Kadƒ±nlar Denizi, Yƒ±lancƒ± Burnu Mevkii, 09400 Ku≈üadasƒ±/Aydƒ±n, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant Kusadasi, Miracle Beach Club is a must-visit destination for those seeking a perfect blend of relaxation and nightlife. By day, it offers an inviting atmosphere where you can bask in the sun on its clean beach while enjoying refreshing drinks. As evening falls, this lively spot transforms into a pulsating dance club featuring high-quality music and impressive sound systems that draw both locals and tourists alike.

sources.snippet: At the entrance, you can enter by paying a certain fee for your needs such as sun loungers, umbrellas, alcohol, etc. Your fun begins with DJ and music. This beach also has a blue flag certificate.

sources.shortName: 24 Kusadasi's Best Beaches, Beach Clubs, Boat Tours (Map included)

places.name: Miracle Beach Club

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our day here. Great service and a really nice beach üëåüèª

AVOID. Miracle ruined my wedding day, the chairs were not set-up for wedding ceremony, tables were not ready and were still being prepared after our celebrations had started, staff were rude, the alter was broken, the swing was not set up, the owner lied and created commotion, the bridal suite beforehand was disgusting! The bathroom was filthy, the only good thing about the venue is the view everything else was the worst I ever experienced, so unprofessional, I would never ever recommend this place.

Ordered pineapple vodka, recieved an apple juice without a drop of alcohol. Arrogant Waiter trying to gaslight me

Obviously they rip drunk people off, I wasn't drunk so I was able to see this hideous behaviour.

Absolutely pathetic

places.generalDescription: Green Beach is a charming small sandy beach located 500m south of another popular spot, Long Beach. It features grassy areas shaded by palm trees and tends to get crowded with locals on weekends. Further along the coast near the National Park are Silver Sands and Love Beach, which offer wider and less crowded spaces for relaxation. The beach club at Kusadasi is a new addition, occupying a large area with a 3-floor complex that includes a restaurant serving delicious meals.

sources.snippet: Green Beach, a further 500m south is a pleasant small sandy beach with grassy areas under its palm trees. At weekends it is packed by locals. Long Beach, south of Kusadasi, stretches for over 3.5 miles (6 km) and services hotels and locals' summer homes, with a choice of cafes, restaurants and watersports.

Green Beach, named for the lush green natural beauty around it, is one of the peaceful and loved beaches in Ku≈üadasƒ±. It is easy to reach because it is close to the city center. This beach is a perfect choice for anyone who wants to relax away from crowds due to its calm atmosphere.

Green Beach is located 2 km further along and is on the same dolmuÔøΩ route as Ladies Beach. This is a small bay with a beach no longer than 100 metres, and surrounded by cascading lawns. It is usually somewhat quiet in the spring and autumn season except during weekends.

A nice and welcoming beach in the Ladies‚Äô Sea area, Green Beach is a serene spot to rest and spend time with your loved ones. You can rent sunbeds and umbrellas for a decent price. Also, the facility‚Äôs cafeteria provides you with food and beverages.
sources.shortName: Ku≈üadasƒ±¬†Beaches Travel Guide: 12 Best Beaches In Kusadasi
Beaches In Kusadasi: A Guide For Cruisers

sources.snippet: At the entrance, you can enter by paying a certain fee for your needs such as sun loungers, umbrellas, alcohol, etc. Your fun begins with DJ and music. This beach also has a blue flag certificate.
Green Beach If you are looking for a fun beach, sunbathing under the shade of palm trees, swimming in blue waters, you can go to Green beach. The beach is clean, and has fine sand.
sources.shortName: Kusadasi Beaches: 7 Beaches and 4 Best Bays in Nature

sources.snippet: Green Beach, also known as Ye≈üil Plaj, is a serene and picturesque beach located in the Kadinlar Denizi District of Ku≈üadasƒ±, Turkey.

sources.shortName: 24 Kusadasi's Best Beaches, Beach Clubs, Boat Tours (Map included)

places.name: Green Beach

reviews.text:
Amazing beach bar experience! ü§ó
The place is really beautiful with clean and clear water. The sandy beach below was perfect for relaxing, making the whole visit a true pleasure. The bar itself is excellent, with delicious food and drinks. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive - we were truly impressed! The entrance fee was 400 TL, which is quite reasonable for everything you get there. Highly recommend!

Fine place, and it's clean. There is a second part of a beach which is less expensive (not the main gate, you need to go down, the name of the beach is OKALI). In most cases, water is clean. It may be crowd during the weekend.

Well choose name for this great place with beautiful water ! We got there with a package including transfer from hotel and back plus entrance, and it was totally worth it. Water is perfect, there's plenty of deck chairs to relax, and great service. We tried coffee, beers and raki served by the beach and enjoyed a great day there.

places.address: Kadƒ±nlar Denizi, 16. Sk. No:9, 09400 Ku≈üadasƒ±/Aydƒ±n, T√ºrkiye
